channel.title: Mod Progrss Bar
channel.description:
People ask us all the time how far along the mod is. Many websites feature a progress bar, that fills up as the mod develops.
Some bars are percent based, eg. 60% done, 70% done. Others are stage based, eg. Pre-Alpha, Alpha, Beta, Gamma, etc.
It would be very cool if the mod could have a progress bar somewhere.

item.title: Mod Progrss Bar
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
CatzEyes93:

Here is how I look at it…

That’s actually not a very good example. It shows only that you didn’t realise you should average the numbers from the different rows instead of adding them all up (giving 0%, 17%, 43%, 59% and 100% for the overall percentages at the bottom of the columns), whereas I think the problem is more how difficult it would be to get all that info into a spreadsheet and keep it accurate than what the results of the spreadsheet would give. For one thing, something may at one time be considered 80% done, but it could then be restarted several times and take three times as long as that just to reach 50% done in the new form, making the numbers in the sheet a mockery.

I think Carlos should have the last word on this:

cman2k:

It’s not that this information is secret, it’s that I purposely withold it. Any time information like this is given out, the public in general finds a way to use it against us. This is the same reason that game developers at large don’t give out this kind of information.

Any kind of status report will be twisted and construed to mean anything to anyone. Some people will try and derive that we are obviously going to be done next week, and someone else will try and definitively prove, using a ridiculous hypothesis, that we won’t finish for another three years. If we slow down for a few weeks because of finals, it will be proof we have abandoned the mod and we are dead. If we do a bunch of work in a short amount of time, it will be proof we have valve’s help or some other ridiculous crap. All it does is add fuel to the fire of false conjecture.

On top of that, people make assumptions and demands. If they think that using their special formula we only have three weeks of work left, they are going to actually be pissed at us for not completing that work in three weeks.

At the end of the day, We are making this for you, the fans like us. But that doesn’t mean we want you to be our boss, and that’s what everyone tries to do. No thanks.

[COLOR=‘Red’]Hence, locked.

Read full topic

item.title: Mod Progrss Bar
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
See, the problem is, now someone will find that bar and assume that it’s official, and before you know it, the entire internet will be spouting “ololol teh balck meas iz nien-tee purcent done omg,” and the devs will be very annoyed, because nothing good can ever come of it for them.

Read full topic

item.title: Mod Progrss Bar
item.dc:creator: The_Assassin47
item.description:
Well for the sake of a status bar, they are at least always moving forward.
Even if it had to be redone, its farther than nothing, so I still think we can say they are 90% done. They know where they’re headed, they know how to get there, they have experimented, they know what they are doing., i that sense they are 90%.

Read full topic

Spooks:

Think again: https://www.blackmesasource.com/progress.html :awesome:

FUCK YES, 2008.

We oughta call Hubi or the fine gentleman above me to update the date, it’s been bugging me for a while (yes, it was still there the whooooole time), maybe add a new twist to the progress bar, something fresh. :3 At least align this motherfucker to the new website layout.

Heres your update, it has to be mathematically at least at this point, or else the team is behind, but I bet they arent. They better not be.

1920×1034 231 KB

Whoops sorry forgot to imitate the blur on the end of the progress bar. Here, fixed.

1920×1034 233 KB

item.title: Mod Progrss Bar
item.dc:creator: Paddy
item.description:
CatzEyes93:

HL2 was released on November 16, 2004 but for the life of me I cant figure out when HL source was released. It HAD to have been about the same time, right? I know the decision to remake the baby was sometime in there right after Christmas or around New Years…

But Jan 2005 was the official “Lets get this puppy made! HOOAH!”

Yeah, i joined the forums around early 2005 i think. Mind you though, when did leak free start?

Read full topic

item.title: Mod Progrss Bar
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
Indeed. Actually, Pareto’s law apply. 80% of the work is done in 20% of the time. The remaining 20% of work take up the other 80% of the time.

Read full topic

item.title: Mod Progrss Bar
item.dc:creator: Flatline
item.description:
Samapico:

It’s a linear interpolation of the mod’s progress from start to finish. Not just a made up number!
And did I blew up your sarcasm-detector by any chance? You might need a new one

So my apology was a waste of politeness then? sigh

And software development is anything BUT linear. The last 5-10% of any project will take a lot longer than any other 5-10% of the project so the figure might as well be made up.

Read full topic

item.title: Mod Progrss Bar
item.dc:creator: Flatline
item.description:
Samapico:

And assassin, you need at least 4 decimals on that percentage. Would give it more credibility. Yeah.

Um, no. An arbitrarily calculated value by a ‘fan’ is never going to have any credibility no matter how many decimal places you add. If the ‘Yeah’ at the end of that was supposed to signify that you were being sarcastic then I apologise but the point still stands for the rest of this rather pointless thread.

Read full topic
